ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Date on which phone screening interview completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Date on which clinic screening interview completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Date on which baseline enrollment interview completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of baseline enrollment interview.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

ElementDescription: Ethnicity of participant
ValueRange: Hispanic or Latino; Not Hispanic or Latino; Unknown

ElementDescription: Site
Treatment arm
Pregnancy risk strata at baseline week 0
Notes: 0 = Low risk strata (Pregnant false), 1 = High risk strata (Pregnant true)

ElementDescription: Clinical status risk strata at baseline week 0
Notes: 1 = Low risk strata (Asymptomatic recovery), 2 = High risk strata (Symptomatic recovery, Prodromal, Recovering, Continued Symptomatic)

ElementDescription: Clinical status risk type at baseline week 0
Notes: Low risk strata: 0 = Asymptomatic recovery; High risk strata: 1 = Symptomatic Recovery,  2 = Recovering, 3 = Prodromal, 4 = Continued Symptomatic

ElementDescription: Psychiatric status rating at baseline week 0
Notes: Low risk strata: 1 = No symptoms (no mild,  moderate, marked, or severe symptoms & no impairment), 1.5 = Mild Symptoms (? 1 mild symptom & no moderate, marked, or severe symptoms & no moderate impairment); High risk strata: 2 = Residual or Prodromal Symptoms (? 1 mild symptom & no moderate, marked, or severe symptoms & no moderate impairment), 3 = Moderate Symptoms (symptom count sum ? 3 or moderate impairment), 4 = Marked Symptoms (symptom count sum ? 3 or marked or severe impairment)

ElementDescription: Weeks to last episode at baseline week 0
Notes: Calculated from baseline assessment date to mid-point of season and year of or age at most recent episode of hypomania, mania, or depression. Seasons defined as Fall= September, October, November; Winter= December, January, February; Spring= March, April, May; Summer= June, July, August. Weeks to last episode thus estimated to about 12 weeks, and if in same year and season as baseline assessment assigned as zero weeks.

ElementDescription: Weeks to last depressive episode at baseline week 0
Notes: Calculated from baseline assessment date to mid-point of season and year of or age at most recent episode of hypomania, mania, or depression. Seasons defined as Fall= September, October, November; Winter= December, January, February; Spring= March, April, May; Summer= June, July, August. Weeks to last episode thus estimated to about 12 weeks, and if in same year and season as baseline assessment assigned as zero weeks.

ElementDescription: Weeks to last manic episode at baseline week 0
Notes: Calculated from baseline assessment date to mid-point of season and year of or age at most recent episode of hypomania, mania, or depression. Seasons defined as Fall= September, October, November; Winter= December, January, February; Spring= March, April, May; Summer= June, July, August. Weeks to last episode thus estimated to about 12 weeks, and if in same year and season as baseline assessment assigned as zero weeks.

ElementDescription: Weeks to last hypomanic episode at baseline week 0
Notes: Calculated from baseline assessment date to mid-point of season and year of or age at most recent episode of hypomania, mania, or depression. Seasons defined as Fall= September, October, November; Winter= December, January, February; Spring= March, April, May; Summer= June, July, August. Weeks to last episode thus estimated to about 12 weeks, and if in same year and season as baseline assessment assigned as zero weeks.

ElementDescription: Number of depressive episodes
Notes: Average from number of depressive episodes at phone screen and midpoint of category at clinic screen

ElementDescription: Number of depressive episodes (MINI) at phone screening
Number of depressive episodes (ADE) at clinic screening
Notes: 0 = 0 episodes, 1 = 1 episode, 2 = 2 episodes, 3 = 3 episodes, 4 = 4-5 episodes, 5 = 6-9 episodes, 6 = 10-20 episodes, 7 = 21-50 episodes, 8 = Too Many To Count, 9 = Indeterminate, 10 = Missing

ElementDescription: Number of manic episodes
Notes: Average from number of manic episodes at phone screen and midpoint of category at clinic screen

ElementDescription: Number of manic episodes (MINI) at phone screening
Number of manic episodes (ADE) at clinic screening
Notes: 1 = 1 episode, 2 = 2 episodes, 3 = 3 episodes, 4 = 4-5 episodes, 5 = 6-9 episodes, 6 = 10-20 episodes, 7 = 21-50 episodes, 8 = Too Many To Count, 9 = Indeterminate, 10 = Missing

ElementDescription: Age in months at first depressive epsiode at phone and clinic screening
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month by years of age

ElementDescription: Age in months at first manic episode at phone and clinic screening
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month by years of age

ElementDescription: Number of psychiatric hospitalizations at phone screening
Number of suicide attempts at phone screening
Notes: 0 = no suicide attempts, 1 = 1 suicide attempt, 2 = 2 suicide attempts, 3 = 3 suicide attempts, 4 = 4-5 suicide attempts, 5 = 6-9 suicide attempts, 6 = 10-20 suicide attempts

ElementDescription: History of psychosis at phone and clinic screening
No current comorbid psychiatric disorder at phone and clinic screening
Current comorbid diagnosis of panic disorder at phone and clinic screening
Current comorbid diagnosis of agoraphobia at phone and clinic screening
Current comorbid diagnosis of generalized anxiety disorder at phone and clinic screening
Current comorbid diagnosis of social phobia at phone and clinic screening
Current comorbid diagnosis of obsessive compulsive disorder at phone and clinic screening
Current comorbid diagnosis of post-traumatic stress disorder at phone and clinic screening
Current comorbid diagnosis of bulimia at phone and clinic screening
Current comorbid diagnosis of anorexia at phone and clinic screening
Current comorbid diagnosis of dysthymia at phone and clinic screening
No lifetime history of comorbid psychiatric disorders at phone screening
Lifetime history of panic disorder or panic attacks at phone screening
Lifetime history of bulimia at clinic screening
Lifetime history of anorexia at clinic screening
Lifetime history of substance use disorder at clinic screening
No family history of bipolar disorder at clinic screening
Nuclear family history of bipolar disorder at clinic screening
Maternal family history of bipolar disorder at clinic screening
Paternal family history of bipolar disorder at clinic screening
No family history of substance use disorder at clinic screening
Nuclear family history of substance use disorder at clinic screening
Maternal family history of substance use disorder at clinic screening
Paternal family history of substance use disorder at clinic screening
No family history of mental health disorder other than bipolar disorder or substance use disorder at clinic screening
Nuclear family history of mental health disorder other than bipolar disorder or substance use disorder at clinic screening
Maternal family history of mental health disorder other than bipolar disorder or substance use disorder at clinic screening
Paternal family history of mental health disorder other than bipolar disorder or substance use disorder at clinic screening
No family history of suicide at clinic screening
Nuclear family history of suicide at clinic screening
Maternal family history of suicide at clinic screening
Paternal family history of suicide at clinic screening
Marital status at phone screening
Notes: 1 = Never married, 2 = Married/domestic partner, 3 = Divorced, 4 = Separated, 5 = Widowed, 6 = Living with significant other

ElementDescription: Number of people in household at phone screening
Highest level of education at phone screening
Notes: 1 = Some high school, 2 = Completed high school/ged, 3 = Some college, 4 = 2-year college, 5 = 4-year college, 6 = Master's degree, 7 = Professional degree, 8 = Doctoral degree

ElementDescription: Employment status at phone screening
Notes: 1 = Employed, 2 = Unemployed, 3 = On disability insurance, 4= Student, 5 = Retired, 6 = Other

ElementDescription: Yearly household income in dollars at phone screening
Date mid-treatment assessment completed
Date post-treatment assessment completed
Date follow-up assessment completed
Checks if completed
Date withdrawn
Reason patient withdrew from study
Notes: 0= Non-compliance; 1= Did not wish to continue in study; 2= Could not tolerate the treatment; 3= Hospitalization; 4= Illness; 5= Death; 6= Family circumstance; 7= Transportation; 8= Other

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
